text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Two persons were confirmed dead on Friday when an oil vessel, Al Zainab exploded at Commandore Pool, a facility for oil tankers in the Lagos port.

- A former chairman of the Nigerian Liquefied Natural Gas Company, Gamaliel Onosode, criticises recent dissolution of its board of directors, saying this can only have a negative impact on Nigeria's dream to export gas.
- Peugeout Automobile of Nigeria is to go into partnership with a local plant to produce some of its car parts.

- Sanctions imposed on Nigeria particularly by the European Union over alleged human rights abuses and lack of democracy are taking a toll on agencies which hitherto depended on foreign grants, says an official of one of the affected agencies.

- Olusola Saraki, national leader of the Congress for National Consensus political party says he will forego his presidential ambition if military ruler General Sani Abacha decides to contest next year's presidential election.

- All people detained over recent ethnic clashes in the oil-producing area of Warri have been freed except those who were found with arms, says Brigadier-General Ibrahim Karmeshe, head of the task force on the crisis.
